intro_text: You notice a sick squirrel at the edge of camp. It's dragging its legs and its eyes looks strange and cloudy. Maybe the warriors would be impressed if you brought home some prey, even if it was already hurt.
decline_text: You decide against it. The Clan would be more impressed if you brought them some healthy prey.

success_outcomes.text: You crouch and make your way towards the stumbling squirrel. Though you're not exactly quiet, the critter doesn't seem to notice you coming, and catching it is easy. You triumphantly grab your catch and drag it over to the fresh-kill pile, proud of your achievement, but when the warriors notice it, they don't seem as happy...

fail_outcomes.text: You creep towards the prey, but beofe you can get to it, a senior warrior scoops you up and tosses you away from it, warning you that the sick prey could be dangerous. They send you back to the nursery while they assemble a crowd to inspect the squirrel.

When you get close to the squirrel, it turns and hisses, which you didn't even know squirrels could do, and swipes your nose before stumbling off beyond the camp walls. Are squirrels really that mean?

intro_text: Tonight, you've finally worked up the courage to sneak out of camp! Making sure no one heard you, you make your way into the territory and find a small swarm of fireflies. You watch them for a bit, entranced. After a while, though, you start to notice that two of the fireflies aren't moving. They're deep inside of a bush. They almost look like... eyes?
decline_text: Suddenly sober of your need for nighttime adventure, you run back to camp to snuggle back into your warm, safe nest.

success_outcomes.text: When you make eye contact, the furious pair of eyes lunges towards you, but the cat can't seem to get themselves free of the branches of the bush. You yelp and race back to camp, your need for adventure thoroughly satisfied.

fail_outcomes.text: Upon meeting your gaze, the creature turns its head and walks away from you. Maybe it's a good thing you have no idea who-- or what-- that was...

intro_text: You poke your nose into the medicine den, curious to see what r_m does in there all day.
decline_text: When {PRONOUN/r_m/subject} {VERB/r_m/shoo/shoos} you away, you leave without a fight.

success_outcomes.text: r_m sees you peering at {PRONOUN/r_m/object} from around the corner and invites you in. When you ask why there's so many different herbs, {PRONOUN/r_m/subject} {VERB/r_m/tell/tells} you that you're never sure what you could need them for, and that it's better to be safe than sorry. Fair enough!

fail_outcomes.text: When {PRONOUN/r_m/subject} {VERB/r_m/see/sees} you, r_m shoos you out of the den, saying {PRONOUN/r_m/subject}{VERB/r_m/'re/'s} too busy to show you around today.

intro_text: There's a mysterious glowing mushroom at the edge of camp.
decline_text: You decide not to touch it.

success_outcomes.text: You creep towards the mushroom and tap it with your paw. Some black spores fly off of it and fall to the ground, heavy. You back away and make a mental note to tell l_n about that later.

You grab r_w_assertive, who decides with you to destroy the thing. You both know that spores can be dangerous, so the warrior rolls a large rock on top of it. Hopefully this will stop its fungus from spreading and destroying any herbs.

fail_outcomes.text: You approach the mushroom and sniff is hesitantly. When you do, it starts to lean towards you, as if it has a mind of its own. Slightly unsettled, you stand up and walk away, hoping it wont follow you, somehow.
You approach the mushroom. Sniffing it hurts your nose, and you decide to back off before it makes you sick.

intro_text: A piece of shiny Twoleg rubbish rolls into camp on the wind. It smells sour and sick.
decline_text: You have better things to focus on. It will likely get carried back out by the wind sometime soon.

success_outcomes.text: You wander towards it, but r_w_neurotic calls out to you, warning you not to get your nose too close. {PRONOUN/r_w_neurotic/subject} finds a large stick and uses it to nudge the weird thing out of camp until it' picked up again by the wind and carried away.

fail_outcomes.text: When you cautiously approach it, the wind picks it back up and sends it right back into your face. You cough and the scent and smack it away.

intro_text: Feeling quite bored with the nursery and envious of all the apprentices and warriors, you decide that you're ready to explore the territory like they do. You squeeze through the gaps of the camp walls undetected, and while you explore the territory, a strong foul smell suddenly catches you off guard.
decline_text: Feeling uneasy by the smell, you decide not to investigate further and return to the nursey. If only you could avoid the lecture that followed with your return!

success_outcomes.text: You follow the smell to a shadowy corner and discover a sickly, infected cat huddled among the leaves and debris. The infected cat is a gaunt, scruffy creature with fur matted and clumped together. Their pelt is mishmash of dirt and grime, streaked through by tangled clumps of fur. Their eyes are dull and cloudy, half-closed, and seem to show but a flicker of life behind them. The sight alone makes you tremble with fear, and you hastily retreat back to the safety of the camp.
You follow the scent all the way to a shallow hole, inside of which you discover the skeleton of an infected cat. Feeling queasy, you stumble back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: You creep forward to investigate, but you find nothing. By the time you return to camp, your Clanmates have been worried sick about you, and you recieve a lecture about sneaking out.
As you creep forward to investigate the noise, you hear a hiss from the shadows and instantly turn to run back to camp, not wanting to find out who-- or what-- that was.

intro_text: You've left camp try try and find some herbs, as you feel awful for the poor medicine cats dealing with this sickness right now. Just as you spot a nice-looking patch several fox-lengths away, you lift your head and see a Twoleg. Or... what you think is a Twoleg. It looks sick, just like the cats back at camp.
decline_text: You leave without gathering any herbs. You don't know what that Twoleg is capable of.

success_outcomes.text: You creep towards the herb patch, keeping an eye on the Twoleg. It doesn't seem to notice you as it stumbles around, bumping into trees and tripping over rocks. Just as you reach the herb patch, it hears you and turns its head. You grab the first herb within reach and bolt back to camp, praying to StarClan that the stupid thing is too slow to try and follow you.

You slowly crawl towards the herb patch, and as you do, the sick Twoleg starts stumbling in the opposite direction. You almost feel bad for the thing. Is that what your Clanmates are going to turn into?

fail_outcomes.text: You start towards the herbs, but snap a twig on your way and the Twoleg turns to look at you. You puff up, ready to turn and run, but the thing trips on a stone and lands face-first in the patch of herbs. You're safe for now, but you return to camp empty-pawed and shaken from the encounter.

The thing is slow, so you make a run for the herbs. You grab a mouthful of random leaves, but the towering Twoleg heard the commotion, and when it turns to walk toward you, it trips and lands right next to you. You yowl as a bloody, grey, Twoleg paw grabs your leg and opens its mouth to bite you. It's by the grace of StarClan that you're able to wiggle free, though you return to camp empty-pawed and very shaken by the ordeal.
Before you can start towards the herbs, the shambling Twoleg turns its head and spots you. You turn and race back home, not wanting to risk dealing with that thing.

intro_text: r_w bursts into camp after an outing. {PRONOUN/r_w/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_w/yell/yells} that one of those infected Twolegs is shambling towards camp!
decline_text: You duck your head and retreat to your den. You're not equipped to help deal with this.

success_outcomes.text: You jump to your paws and follow r_w's impromptu patrol out of camp, leaving the concerned muttering of your Clanmates behind you. What must be less than ten fox lengths from the camp's entrance, you see a Twoleg. It's clearly sick, extremely dirty, and very torn up and bloodied. You, r_w and the rest of the patrol are able to draw it away and lead it towards the river, into which it stumbles and disappears.

You jump to your paws to volunteer, but by the time r_w notices you, they've already assembled a group of warriors. They tell you to stay back and help guard the camp. The patrol returns some time later, and r_w remarks, covered in Twoleg blood, that things went well.

fail_outcomes.text: You eagerly jump up to assist, but as you start to leave camp, you run right into the Twoleg, trying to crawl through the entrance! With a snarl, you swipe at its gaunt face, and it doesn't react. It ends up taking every warrior in the Clan to drag the thing backwards and lead it out of the territory.

You volunteer immediately and race out of camp with r_w to take care of the problem. However, the Twoleg has already covered more ground than r_w anticipated, and you run right into it. The thing stumbles and lands right on top of r_w, but {PRONOUN/r_w/subject}{VERB/r_w/'re/'s} able to scramble out of the beast's grip and disappear into the territory, panicked. When the Twoleg pursues, all you can do is return home and hope that r_w is able to get away.

intro_text: Today, you've decided to head out into the territory and find some herbs. The medicine cats are always looking for more, and you can tell how stressed they are about this whole situation.
decline_text: You end up turning around and heading back to camp empty-pawed. You're not a medicine cat-- what will you know about the right herbs to gather?

success_outcomes.text: You end up finding a patch of herbs you recognise and you bring them back to the medicine cats, who thank you enthusiastically for the help.

fail_outcomes.text: You search the territory for a while, but you're unable to find any herbs that you recognise.

intro_text: You see a mysterious figure on the border. As it walks the border, it stumbles, as if weighed down by something. Maybe they're sick..?
decline_text: Unnerved, you decide to head back to camp and hope that they're okay. You can't deal with this right now.

success_outcomes.text: You can't leave an injured cat to fend for themselves. You approach {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object}, and when you offer {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} a place to recover, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/look/looks} like {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} barely {VERB/n_c:0/hear/hears} you. {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject/CAP} {VERB/n_c:0/do/does}, however, turn and {VERB/n_c:0/stagger/staggers} after you when you start back towards camp. {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject/CAP} must be really out of it. You hope that the Clan will be able to help {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object}.

fail_outcomes.text: You approach the cat, but before you can offer them a place to recover, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/lunge/lunges} towards you with a snarl. {PRONOUN/n_c:0/poss/CAP} eyes are wild and clouded... maybe you should leave {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} alone.

intro_text: Today, you've decided to investigate a section of the territory you haven't been to in a while. When you get there, you find that every herb patch you can remember has been torn to shreds. You hear a noise behind you and whip around, locking your gaze with two mysterious, glowing eyes situated deep within the trees.
decline_text: Your stomach drops, and you immediately turn tail and race back to camp. Whatever that was, it can have those barren herb patches for itself!

success_outcomes.text: The eyes start moving, and you freeze. What stumbles out of the trees is a cat, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/look/looks}... sick. When you offer to bring {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} back home for some treatment, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} feverishly {VERB/n_c:0/nod/nods} and {VERB/n_c:0/follow/follows} you back at a distance.

fail_outcomes.text: Before you can react, the owner of the eyes bursts out of the trees and tackles you to the ground. Your attacker seems to have a very strange illness, however, and it seems to have weakened them. You're able to kick the cat off of you, and run back to camp without being pursued, even though it hurts your heart as a medicine cat to abandon a sick cat like that.

intro_text: You've gotten a bit lost today while searching for herbs without your mentor. Unsure of your location, you decide to just follow the scent of herbs, and when you finally find the source, you see that every herb in the patch has been torn to shreds. You hear a noise behind you and whip around, locking your gaze with two mysterious, glowing eyes situated deep within the trees.
decline_text: Your stomach drops, and you immediately turn tail and race back int he direction you came from. Whatever that was, it can have those barren herb patches for itself!

success_outcomes.text: The eyes start moving, and you freeze. What stumbles out of the trees is a cat, and {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} {VERB/n_c:0/look/looks}... sick. When you offer to bring {PRONOUN/n_c:0/object} back home for some treatment, {PRONOUN/n_c:0/subject} feverishly {VERB/n_c:0/nod/nods} and {VERB/n_c:0/follow/follows} you back at a distance.

fail_outcomes.text: Before you can react, the owner of the eyes bursts out of the trees and tackles you to the ground. Your attacker seems to have a very strange illness, however, and it seems to have weakened them. You're able to kick the cat off of you, and run back to camp without being pursued, even though it hurts your heart as a medicine cat to abandon a sick cat like that.

intro_text: r_m_neurotic, frantically, asks you to fetch them an herb. {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/subject/CAP}{VERB/r_m_neurotic/'ve/'s} been frantically trying to treat {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/poss} infected patients all day, and you know that accidentally handing {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/object} the wrong herb might cause some sort of explosion...
decline_text: You tell r_m_neurotic that you're not confident to find the herb for {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/object}, and {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/subject} {VERB/r_m_neurotic/snap/snaps} at you to get away from the medicine den if you're going to be of no help.

success_outcomes.text: You wrack your brain and locate the herb that r_m_neurotic was looking for. When you hand it to {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/object}, {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/subject} {VERB/r_m_neurotic/thank/thanks} you with a nod, then all but shove you back out of the medicine den, that herb having done nothing to ease {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/poss} stress. Poor cat.

You have no idea what this herb is! You grab a random one from the stores and hand it over, and to your surprise, it appears to be the right one! r_m_neurotic thanks you briefly before turning back to {PRONOUN/r_m_neurotic/poss} work.

fail_outcomes.text: You have no idea what this herb is! You grab a random leaf from the stores and hand it over, but r_m_neurotic just slaps it out of your paws and shoves you back out of the medicine den. It seems that medicine is still not your calling.

intro_text: While guarding the camp one night, you spot a pair of glowing, infected eyes moving about in the trees. You unsheathe your claws and creep towards the camp's edge, ready to protect your Clan from further illness.
decline_text: You decide against it, not wanting to risk the infected cat fighting back.

success_outcomes.text: When the creature's eyes lock with your, they disappear, and you hear footsteps receding into the territory. Hopefully they'll run far enough to cross the border and never come back.

You creep towards the creature until you're mere tail-lengths away, then attack. The squabble is quick, and as soon as the cat is able to wriggle out of your grasp, they turn and sprint away from camp, leaving a few chunks of fur behind.

fail_outcomes.text: As you sneak forwards to launch a surprise attack on the infected creature, you accidentally kick a pebble, and the infected hears you. Luckily, all they do is hiss before stumbling away from camp, not wanting to put up a fight,

Just as you're close enough to attack, the infected creature notices you and leaps at you before you can react. You yowl for help as the sick rogue's fangs reach for your throat, and luckily a group of warriors wakes up to save you and get rid of your assailant for good.

intro_text: r_w_infected calls your name from the edge of the medicine den, infection clouding {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/poss} eyes.
decline_text: You turn and leave. You don't want to risk having an idle chat with such a potentially dangerous cat.

success_outcomes.text: You look {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/poss} way, but don't move any closer. r_w_infected tells you that {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/subject} {VERB/r_w_infected/appreciate/appreciates} you being here for {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/object}, even though {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/subject} {VERB/r_w_infected/don't/doesn't} think you'll find a cure. You tell {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/object} not to think like that.

fail_outcomes.text: You slowly approach the cat, but {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/subject} {VERB/r_w_infected/start/starts} hissing when you draw near. You retreat. You'll speak to {PRONOUN/r_w_infected/object} later, when the infection isn't actively taking its toll.

intro_text: c_n has decided on a specific herb to search for. Not satisfied with your stores, you set out at night to go find some for yourself.
decline_text: On second thought, heading out of camp at night is dangerous. You head back home, certain you can find some in a patrol tomorrow instead.

success_outcomes.text: Your search is successful! You bring home a decent stock to attempt to treat your patients in the morning.

fail_outcomes.text: Despite your resolve, you're unable to find the herb. You head back to camp when the sun starts to rise.

intro_text: Perched on a tree just outside of c_n camp, you survey the territory, trying to locate any new herb patch locations that you may not have spotted from the ground.
decline_text: A gale of wind shakes your branch and you decide to return to the ground where you'll be safer.

success_outcomes.text: After a few moments, you spot an unfamiliar patch of colour. Making a mental note of where it is, you return to the ground and grab a couple of Clanmates to go investigate it with you. When you get there, you find a fresh patch of herbs!

You think you see an unfamiliar cat stalking through the undergrowth. When you get back down to the ground and run to the scene, all that you find is the scent of a rogue and a conveniently packed bundle of herbs. Did someone leave this here for you..?

fail_outcomes.text: You think you spot a new patch of colour, but when you get down to the ground and rush out of camp to find it, you can't find the spot you were looking at. You wander around for a while before giving up and heading back home.
It's almost the entire day that you're up in that tree, but you're unable to spot anything.

intro_text: It's been an exhausting day. You lift your head and stare up at the sky. Does StarClan have anything to say about this?
decline_text: You don't need to know. StarClan can't help your Clanmates-- only you can. You stand up to get back to work.

success_outcomes.text: After a moment of waiting, you start to feel a presence. Suddenly, d_c's starry pelt is in front of you. They don't say a word, but they drop a gift at your paws, give you a nod, and dissipate into the trees.
The stars seem to have nothing to say. However, just when you're about to stand up and leave, you feel something smack you in the face. The wind has blown some herbs right into your paws!

fail_outcomes.text: You wait for a long time, but recieve no answer. Frustrated, you hiss under your breath that you don't need StarClan's help anyway and return to the medicine den, tail twitching.

You wait for a long time for a response from your ancestors, but instead of some reassurance, it starts raining. You're forced to abandon your prayer and head back inside. Did StarClan send that rain? Are they upset with you and your Clan?

intro_text: You're out on a late patrol with r_w as you realize the two of you seem to be lost out in the territory. Your companion swears {PRONOUN/r_w/subject} {VERB/r_w/know.knows} precisely where you both are, volunteering to take the lead, but you have your doubts and the weather is starting to turn. Should you trust {PRONOUN/r_w/poss} instincts?
decline_text: You tell your patrolmate to stop acting like {PRONOUN/r_w/subject} {VERB/r_w/know/knows} the way ahead, because you two are clearly lost. There's a bit of grumbling as you both go to retrace your steps, but you make it back to camp safely and swiftly, only a little ruffled from the wind.

success_outcomes.text: You follow r_w, deciding to put your faith in {PRONOUN/r_w/poss} sense of direction. Unfortunately, said sense proves to be lacking and it takes half an eternity to find your way back, frustration and unease rising in both of you as the evening wears on into dusk. The two of you make it home eventually with stray leaves plastered to your pelts by the wind, ruffled but unhurt, besides {PRONOUN/r_w/poss} pride and your patience.

fail_outcomes.text: You walk for so long that it feels like your paws are going to fall off, brush and low branches whipping both of your faces as you wander with what turns out to be no direction at all. Neither of you want to stop and rest, however, your growing frustration quickly being set aside. Ill scents drift over on the breeze and you become less sure if it was merely paranoia talking when you thought you heard an extra set of pawsteps a bit ago. It's a great relief when you finally start to recognize the landmarks again, r_w's unease turning to simple sheepishness, and the two of you return with only some soreness and a few little scratches.

intro_text: While out patrolling the border, you spot an infected Twoleg stumbling through a field in the distance.
decline_text: You turn and leave. Though it's far, you can't risk being spotted.

success_outcomes.text: You watch for a moment as the thing wanders aimlessly. Suddenly, there's a loud bang, and the Twoleg falls to the ground. Two more uninfected Twolegs suddenly come into view, and they look over the infected body before walking away. Whatever just happened, you don't want to be a part of it, and you race back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: As you sit and watch, the Twoleg turns its head and seems to notice you. You turn and flee immediately, knowing the thing will be too slow to find you, but still a bit shaken.
